New Records: Andrew Benintendi tied his career high with his 20th homer.
Chicago White Sox set the post-1900 record for losses with 121.
Key Match Events: Sean Burke pitched two-hit ball over five innings, striking out six and walking three.
Michael Soroka struck out five in three innings without allowing a baserunner.
Gus Varland finished a three-hitter, marking the seventh shutout for the White Sox.
Bryan Ramos hit a solo homer for the White Sox.
Andrew Vaughn hit an RBI single in the sixth inning.
Andrew Benintendi hit a two-run homer in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Detroit manager A.J. Hinch commented on missed opportunities early in the game.
Sean Burke reflected on his performance and the playing conditions.
A.J. Hinch mentioned the energy from the previous night's celebration and the impact of the weather delay.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game started 2 hours, 20 minutes late due to inclement weather.
Detroit clinched its first postseason berth since 2014 with its 10th win in 11 games on Friday.
Jackson Jobe, a 22-year-old Detroit right-hander, had a hitless three-inning relief stint with his first two career strikeouts.
